trans-unit.source: Represents a document viewing control that can host paginated <xref href="System.Windows.Documents.FixedDocument"></xref> content such as an <xref href="System.Windows.Xps.Packaging.XpsDocument"></xref>.
Customizing the DocumentViewer Control
To apply the same property settings to multiple <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer> controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).

To see the parts and states that are specific to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer>, see [DocumentViewer Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/documentviewer-styles-and-templates.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer> control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer"></xref> class.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer"></xref> can zoom out more.
The minimum zoom value is 5%.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.CanDecreaseZoom%2A> property becomes `false` when the minimum zoom level is reached.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the control can zoom out more; otherwise, `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.CanDecreaseZoom"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer"></xref> can zoom in more.
The maximum zoom value is 5000%.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.CanIncreaseZoom%2A> becomes `false` when the maximum zoom level is reached.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the control can zoom in more; otherwise, `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.CanIncreaseZoom"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer"></xref> can move down more in the document.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the control can move down more in the document; otherwise, `false` if the document is at the bottom.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.CanMoveDown"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer"></xref> can move more to the left in the document.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the control can move more left in the document; otherwise, `false` if the document is at the leftmost edge.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.CanMoveLeft"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer"></xref> can move more to the right in the document.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the control can move more to the right in the document; otherwise, `false` if the document is at the rightmost edge.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.CanMoveRight"></xref> dependency property.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer"></xref> can move up more in the document.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`true` if the control can move up more in the document; otherwise, `false` if the document is at the topmost edge.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.CanMoveUp"></xref> dependency property.
Zooms out of the document content by one zoom step.
The following are the zoom level increments.
The minimum zoom level is 5%.
After the minimum zoom level is reached, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.DecreaseZoom%2A> has no more effect.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.CanDecreaseZoom%2A> property returns `false` when the minimum zoom level is reached.
Gets the overall vertical height of the paginated document.
For vertical page arrangements, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ExtentHeight%2A> is the sum of all the page heights and includes the space between pages.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The overall vertical height of the paginated content specified in device independent pixels.
The default is 0.0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ExtentHeight"></xref> dependency property.
Gets the overall horizontal width of the paginated document.
For horizontal page arrangements, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ExtentWidth%2A> is the sum of all the page widths and includes the space between pages.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The current horizontal width of the content layout area specified in device independent pixels.
The default is 0.0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ExtentWidth"></xref> dependency property.
Moves focus to the find toolbar to search the document content.
Fits a single page to the height of the current viewport.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.RoutedUICommand"></xref> that performs the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.FitToHeight"></xref> operation.
The routed command that performs the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.FitToHeight"></xref> operation.
Fits the document to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.MaxPagesAcross"></xref> property setting.
Fits the document to a specified maximum number of page widths.
The maximum number of pages to fit in the current <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ExtentWidth"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.RoutedUICommand"></xref> that performs the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.MaxPagesAcross"></xref> operation.
The routed command that performs the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.MaxPagesAcross"></xref> operation.
Fits a single page to the width of the current viewport.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.RoutedUICommand"></xref> that performs the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.FitToWidth"></xref> operation.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.FitToWidth%2A> sets the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer> control to display a single page width with pages zoomed to the width of the current viewport.
The routed command that performs the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.FitToWidth"></xref> operation.
Returns a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView"></xref> elements that are currently displayed.

When this method returns, contains `true` if the collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView"></xref> elements changed after the last call to <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.GetPageViewsCollection(System.Boolean@)"></xref>; otherwise, `false`.

The collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentPageView"></xref> elements that are currently displayed in the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer"></xref> control.
Gets or sets the horizontal scroll position.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.HorizontalOffset%2A> property causes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer> control to scroll to the specified horizontal offset.
The horizontal offset is measured from the left edge of the visible content area.

When setting this property in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], you cannot use the unit qualifiers (such as `in` or `cm`) that are enabled for many other "Width" or "Horizontal" properties.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to **true**
The current horizontal scroll position specified in device independent pixels.
The initial default is 0.0.
The value specified to set is negative.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.HorizontalOffset"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the horizontal space between pages.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.HorizontalPageSpacing%2A> property adjusts the horizontal spacing between pages.

When setting this property in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], you cannot use the unit qualifiers (such as `in` or `cm`) that are enabled for many other "Width" or "Horizontal" properties.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The horizontal space between displayed pages specified in device independent pixels.
The default is 10.0.
The value specified to set is negative.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.HorizontalPageSpacing"></xref> dependency property.
Zooms in on the document content by one zoom step.
The following are the zoom level increments.
The maximum zoom value is 5000%.
After the maximum zoom level is reached, <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.IncreaseZoom%2A> has no more effect.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.CanIncreaseZoom%2A> property returns `false` when the maximum zoom level is reached.
Gets or sets a value defining the maximum number of page columns to display.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.MaxPagesAcross%2A> can be set to a positive integer value from 1 to 32, inclusive.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The maximum number of page columns to be displayed.
The default is 1.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.MaxPagesAcross"></xref> dependency property.
Scrolls the document content down 16 device independent pixels.
Scrolls the document content left 16 device independent pixels.
Scrolls the document content right 16 device independent pixels.
Scrolls the document content up 16 device independent pixels.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.FrameworkElement.ApplyTemplate"></xref> method.

Responds to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.OnBringIntoView(System.Windows.DependencyObject,System.Windows.Rect,System.Int32)"></xref> method from the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase"></xref> implementation.
The base implementation will move the master page to the page on which the element occurs.
The object to make visible.
The rectangular region of the element to make visible.
The number of the page to be viewed.
Creates and returns an <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for this <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer"></xref> control.
The new <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.DocumentViewerAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.DecreaseZoom"></xref> method.
Responds to calls when the document to display is changed.

<xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.OnDocumentChanged%2A> responds to calls when the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.Document%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer> control is set to display a new document.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.Find"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.FirstPage"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.FitToHeight"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.FitToMaxPagesAcross"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.FitToMaxPagesAcross(System.Int32)"></xref> method.
The number of pages to fit across the content area.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.FitToWidth"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.GoToPage(System.Int32)"></xref> method.
`pageNumber` is a positive (non-negative, non-zero) page number that starts at one (1).
The page number to position to.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.IncreaseZoom"></xref> method.
Responds to <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.KeyDown"></xref> events.
The event data.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.LastPage"></xref> method.
Responds to <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.MouseLeftButtonDown"></xref> events.
The event data.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.MoveDown"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.MoveLeft"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.MoveRight"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.MoveUp"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.NextPage"></xref> method.
Responds to <xref href="System.Windows.UIElement.PreviewMouseWheel"></xref> events.
The event data.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.DocumentViewerBase.PreviousPage"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ScrollPageDown"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ScrollPageLeft"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ScrollPageRight"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ScrollPageUp"></xref> method.
Responds to calls to the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ViewThumbnails"></xref> method.
Scrolls down one viewport.
Scrolls left one viewport.
Scrolls right one viewport.
Scrolls up one viewport.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether drop-shadow page borders are displayed.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
`true` if drop-shadow borders are displayed; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ShowPageBorders"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the vertical scroll position.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.VerticalOffset%2A> must be set with non-negative offset values.
Setting a negative value raises an <xref:System.ArgumentException> exception.
The vertical offset is measured from the top of the visible content area.

When setting this property in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], you cannot use the unit qualifiers (such as `in` or `cm`) that are enabled for many other "Height" or "Vertical" properties.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The current vertical scroll position offset in device independent pixels.
The default is 0.0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.VerticalOffset"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the vertical spacing between displayed pages.
Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.VerticalPageSpacing%2A> property adjusts the vertical spacing between pages to the specified value.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.VerticalPageSpacing%2A> value must be non-negative.
Setting this property to a negative value will raise an <xref:System.ArgumentException> exception.

When setting this property in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], you cannot use the unit qualifiers (such as `in` or `cm`) that are enabled for many other "Height" or "Vertical" properties.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The vertical space between displayed pages in device independent pixels.
The default is 10.0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.VerticalPageSpacing"></xref> dependency property.
Gets the vertical size of the scrollable content area.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The vertical size of the scrollable content area in device independent pixels.
The default is 0.0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ViewportHeight"></xref> dependency property.
Gets the horizontal size of the scrollable content area.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The horizontal size of the scrollable content area in device independent pixels.
The default is 0.0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ViewportWidth"></xref> dependency property.
Displays a thumbnail representation of the pages.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Input.RoutedUICommand"></xref> that performs the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ViewThumbnails"></xref> operation.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ViewThumbnailsCommand%2A> sizes and arranges the view to display a thumbnail preview of each page.
The following table shows the keyboard shortcut key associated with this command.
Shortcut Key
[none]
The routed command that performs the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.ViewThumbnails"></xref> operation.
Gets or sets the document zoom percentage.
Setting this property causes the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer> control to zoom to the specified value.
The <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.Zoom%2A> property must be a value between 5.0 to 5000.0 (inclusive), which corresponds to a percentage range 5.0% to 5000.0%.
Actions or commands that require a layout update may change the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.Zoom%2A> property setting.

For example, changing the value of <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.MaxPagesAcross%2A>, calling the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.FitToHeight%2A> method, or invoking the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.FitToHeightCommand%2A> can cause the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.Zoom%2A> setting to change.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
The zoom percentage expressed as a value, 5.0 to 5000.0.
The default is 100.0, which corresponds to 100.0%.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.DocumentViewer.Zoom"></xref> dependency property.
